p: To determine whether internalization of DENV NS1 is dependent on clathrin, we utilized a common chemical inhibitor of clathrin-mediated endocytosis. Pitstop 2 is a selective inhibitor of clathrin-mediated endocytosis that acts by blocking ligand access to the clathrin N-terminal domain [ 31]. Pretreating HPMEC with Pitstop 2 abrogated NS1 colocalization with Rab5, suggesting inhibition of internalization ( Fig 4E and 4F). These data suggest that DENV NS1 is internalized in a clathrin-dependent manner.
